intro: Anisanthera hastata, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed. Anisanthera hastata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been introduced to other regions, sometimes becoming invasive.
